doc.str: Methods and systems for membrane testing

A method for testing the integrity of a membrane includes steps of placing a magnetically susceptible material in a fluid upstream of the membrane, collecting the material downstream of the membrane using a magnetic field, and detecting the material using a sensor.

"The construction and commissioning of a 24 MGD ultrafiltration plant with on-line integrity testing to monitor and maintain the barrier to cryptoporidium sized particles," AWWA Conference (Mar. 2001). cited by other . | "Predicting log removal performance of membrane systems using in-situ integrity testing," proceedings Annual Conference AWWA, 411-419 (1997). cited by other . | "Advances in the Preparation of Magnetic Nanoparticles by the Microemulsion Method," Lopez et al., The Journal of Physical Chemistry B, vol. 101, No. 41, 8046-8047 (Oct. 9, 1997). cited by other . | "The Water Supply (Water Quality) (Amendment) Regulations 1999: Cryptosporidium in Water Suppliers," Drinking Water Inspectorate: Information Letter, http://www.dwi.gov.uk/regs/infolett/1999/info1699.html, (2001). cited by other . | "Continuous Cultivation and Recovery of Magnetotactic Bacteria," Bahaj et al., IEEE Transactions on Magnetics, vol. 33, #5, 4263-265 (Sep. 1997). cited by other . | "Field Evaluation of Ceramic Microfiltration Membranes in Drinking Water Treatment," Rajagopalan, et al.
